item.description:
MDG August 2011 Forum: Diabetes: A Major Public Health Problem - The Challenge for Medical Device Companies When: Wednesday, September 14, 2011, 5:30 PM Where: Foley Hoag Emerging Enterprise Center, Bay Colony Corporate Center, 1000 Winter Street, Suite 4000 North Entrance, Waltham, MA Website & Registration: http://www.meddevgroup.org (Registration Fee: Members: $25 (Pre-paid), $35 at the door, Nonmembers: $35 (PrePaid), $45 at the door)

WHO SHOULD ATTEND : Individuals in the MDG community who want to better understand medical device and related life science opportunities in the management of this global disease challenge;Clinical/medical professionals dedicated to the management of patients with diabetes and/or the elimination this significant disease; Anyone involved in the Research & Development of products and services focused on the discovery and /or treatment of diabetes

Keynote Speaker: John Brooks, President and CEO of Joslin Diabetes Center
Panelists: Duane DeSisto, President, CEO and director of Insulet. Insulet has developed the world’s first tubing-free insulin pump, the OmniPod; Dr. Howard Wolpert, Joslin Clinic. Dr. Wolpert, a world-renowned physician/researcher, established and directs the Insulin Pump & Continuous Glucose Monitoring Programs at Joslin Clinic
Moderator: Kevin Dolan, Senior Human Resources Consultant at Harvard Medical School. Mr. Dolan was one of the recent winners of the Harvard Catalyst sponsored crowd-sourcing experiment to propose new ideas that could help lead to a cure or improved care for Type I diabetes.
item.name: A Major Public Health Problem - The Challenge for Medical Device Companies
